rundown: 5-6 L @ Texas Rangers Grant Holmes: 4.0 innings, 4 earned runs, 6 hits, 0 HR, 2 strikeouts Batters: Michael Harris II (4 hits - 5 AB, 1 HR, 2 RBI) Jurickson Profar (1 hit - 4 AB, 1 RBI) Ozzie Albies (1 hit - 4 AB, 1 RBI) The Braves fell short in a close game against the Texas Rangers, losing by a single run. Despite a strong performance from Michael Harris II, who contributed significantly with 4 hits including a home run, the Braves could not secure the win. Key highlights include: 1. Michael Harris II's standout performance with 4 hits and 3 runs scored. 2. Grant Holmes struggled on the mound, allowing 4 earned runs in just 4 innings. 3. The Braves managed to match the Rangers in hits (8 each), but could not capitalize on scoring opportunities.
